metadata.title: CVE-2024-24816 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: CKEditor4 is an open source what-you-see-is-what-you-get HTML editor. Across-site scripting vulnerability vulnerability has been discovered inversions prior to 4.24.0-lts in samples that use the `preview` feature. Allintegrators that use these samples in the production code can be affected.The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute JavaScript code by abusingthe misconfigured preview feature. It affects all users using the CKEditor4 at version < 4.24.0-lts with affected samples used in a productionenvironment. A fix is available in version 4.24.0-lts.

criterions.comment: ckeditor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ldap-account-manager: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
request-tracker4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
